values: I resigned because of their discrimination.
I refer to my recent resignation due to [insert protected characteristic] discrimination.
I have been instructed by the above named client, who resigned because they were discriminated against.
I resigned because of mistreatment due to whistleblowing and discrimination.
I resigned because of mistreatment due to whistleblowing and discrimination
I refer to my recent resignation, which was due to discrimination and mistreatment because of my whistleblowing. This amounts to automatically unfair and discriminatory constructive dismissal.
I have been instructed by the above named client, who resigned due to discrimination and maltreatment due to whistleblowing.
I refer to unjustified disciplinary process.
Jordan Davies, Without Prejudice Letter - Constructive Dismissal
I'm writing in respect of unlawful treatment I suffered at work.
I write in relation to unlawful treatment I have suffered at work.
I have been instructed by the above named client, who has been treated unlawfully at work.
I refer to my resignation due to health and safety concerns.
I resigned because I had health and safety concerns
I refer to my recent resignation that was due to health and safety concerns.
The employer didn't pay my furlough in full
I refer to unlawful deductions made from my wages, specifically in relation to furlough payments.
I have been instructed by the above named client, who wasn't paid as entitled whilst on furlough.
I'm writing in relation to an unlawful deduction from my wages.
I refer to unlawful deductions made from my wages.
I'm writing regarding my employment situation.
I write in relation to my employment situation.
I'm writing further to my dismissal because of performance.
I was dismissed for poor performance
I refer to my unfair dismissal on the purported ground of poor performance.
I'm writing regarding the current redundancy process, which I believe to be unfair and discriminatory.
I refer to the current redundancy process.
I'm writing further to my recent resignation.
I refer to my recent resignation.
Resigned because of unlawful deductions of wages - constructive dismissal.
I resigned because my pay was cut
I resigned because of unlawful deductions of wages that are a fundamental breach of my contract of employment.
I refer to my suspension which was unjustified.
I refer to my suspension from work on [date].
Following my recent dismissal, I'm writing to express serious concerns.
I refer to my recent unfair dismissal.
I resigned because of mistreatment due to whistleblowing.
I resigned because of mistreatment due to whistleblowing
I refer to my recent resignation due to mistreatment because of my whistleblowing. This amounts to automatically unfair constructive dismissal.

I was bullied by the following actions.

[provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible].
This was part of a sustained campaign of humiliation, professional undermining and bullying.
It's clear that my treatment was discriminatory.
My treatment was discriminatory and I have reasons to support that

My treatment was due to my [protected characteristic(s)]. That's clear because:

[Explain why. Remember it’s not always obvious why the treatment is discriminatory, however bad it is. Always compare to how someone else of a different sex, race etc was/would have been treated (except for disability where you don't have to compare). Aim to explain the discriminatory reason(s) as clearly as possible.

E.g. ‘There were three of us who lost office keys. I was the only female and the only one disciplined. The two male colleagues didn’t face any consequences.’

NB: you don’t need this paragraph if the examples of bad treatment you provided in the previous paragraph are self-explanatory, e.g. racist or sexist jokes.]
Your actions had a discriminatory motive as there is no rational explanation to such appalling treatment.
My treatment was discrimninatory, but I can't really give clear reasons why

Your actions were motivated by my [insert protected characteristic] as there is no rational explanation to such appalling treatment.

[Use this paragraph if you can't give clear reasons why the treatment was discriminatory.]
I was subjected to unlawful discrimination.
I was discriminated against (but not harassed)

I was subjected to unlawful [insert protected characteristic(s)] discrimination, in particular:

[provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible].
There was a lack of empathy so that I feel bullied. This is discrimination.
I felt bullied due to lack of empathy

There was a lack of empathy for my situation to the extent that I felt bullied. This would amount to discrimination on the grounds of [insert protected characteristic].

[provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible].
I was harassed and discriminated against

I was subjected to [protected characteristic(s)] harassment and/or direct discrimination, in particular:

[provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible].
There has been a lack of empathy so that I feel bullied. This is discrimination.
I've felt bullied due to lack of empathy

There has been a lack of empathy for my situation to the extent that I feel bullied. This would amount to discrimination on the grounds of [insert protected characteristic].

[provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible].
I've been harassed and discriminated against

I’ve been subjected to [protected characteristic(s)] harassment and/or direct discrimination, in particular:

[provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible].
I've been subjected to unlawful discrimination
I've been discriminated against (but not harassed)

I’ve been subjected to unlawful [insert protected characteristic(s)] discrimination, in particular:

[provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible].
I complained about discrimination and I was victimised.
I was treated badly because I complainted about discrimination

On [date] I complained that I'd been discriminated against [to who and how]. This was a protected act. After making my protected act, I was subjected to the following detriments: 

[provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible]. 

This amounts to unlawful victimisation.
I complained about discrimination and have been victimised.
I've been treated badly because I complained about discrimination

On [date] I complained that I'd been discriminated against [to who and how]. This was a protected act. After making my protected act, I've been subjected to the following detriments: 

[provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible]. 

This amounts to unlawful victimisation.
I have a physical or mental condition.
I have a physical or mental condition
[As you’re aware,] I have [condition name(s)], which is a disability. [My absence from work on [dates] was caused by my disability.]
You didn't consider making reasonable adjustments for me.
They didn't consider making reasonable adjustments for my condition
You didn’t consider making reasonable adjustments for me, as required by the Equality Act 2010 [add detail if possible - what reasonable adjustments could’ve been helpful?].
Ethical veganism has been accepted by the employment tribunals as a form of protected belief.
I've suffered discrimination due to my veganism
Ethical veganism is a protected philosophical belief under the Equality Act 2010.
I've paid less for equal work because of my gender.
I've been paid less for equal work because of my sex

I've been paid less than a male colleague for equal work. [add details here] Chapter 3 of the Equality Act 2010 implies an "equality clause" into every employment contract, which means that you have breached my contract by paying me less than this colleague.
Disciplinary process/action against me is unfair.
The disciplinary process against me is unfair

The disciplinary process against me is unjustified and unfair, and any resulting disciplinary action would clearly be unfair. In particular: [add up to three bullet points with the strongest reasons that it is unfair. Examples: lack of evidence; that even if proven, the action wasn't misconduct; bias. Try to explain your reasons.]
Lack of empathy makes me want to resign

Your lack of empathy amounts to a fundamental breach of the implied term of trust and confidence in our employment agreement. This would entitle me to resign and claim compensation for unfair constructive dismissal in an employment tribunal.
I resigned due to excessive workload

My workload was so excessive and stressful it constituted a repudiatory breach of contract. Therefore, my resignation was unfair constructive dismissal. 

In particular, [provide up to three bullet points showing how your employer treated you so badly. If just one point, keep on this line. If more than one, bullet point format is good.]
I wasn't given a written contract of employment
I wasn't provided with a written statement of my main employment terms, as required by the Employment Rights Act.
Haven't been provided with employment particulars in writing.
I haven't been given a written contract of employment
I haven't been provided with a written statement of my main employment terms, as required by the Employment Rights Act.

I requested an updated contract as the only contract in my possession was that dated [. ] when I joined the business. This was not issued at the time of request in February 2019, nor has it been issued subsequently, though I have been working in that position. This is a breach of the employer’s duty to provide the employee with a written statement of initial employment particulars or of any changes to their terms of employment.
Adapted for this sheet from Coronavirus health & safety template
I was asked to attend a workplace that wasn't Coronavirus secure

I was asked to attend a workplace that was unsafe due to Coronavirus, which is in breach of your health and safety duty. It was unsafe because [explain why it was unsafe, e.g. 'due to the number of people in the office it was impossible to maintain a safe distance'; 'there were no ventilation in the seminar room where I was required to teach'.]  

I could've carried out my role remotely, but I wasn't allowed.
Subjeced to detriment because of refusing to attend an unsafe workplace.
I've been mistreated because I refused to attend an unsafe workplace

I've been mistreated because of my refusal to attend an unsafe workplace, which is against the Employment Rights Act

[provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples of the detriment/mistreatment - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible].
I'm being asked to attend a workplace that isn't Coronavirus secure

I'm being asked to attend a workplace that is unsafe due to Coronavirus, which is in breach of your health and safety duty. It's unsafe because [explain why it's unsafe, e.g. 'due to the number of people in the office it's impossible to maintain a safe distance'; 'there is no ventilation in the seminar room where I'm required to teach'.]  

I could carry out my role remotely, but I'm not being allowed.
You failed your health & safety duty - coronavirus unsafe workplace.
I'm considering resigning because the employer is making me attend an unsafe workplace

Your insistence that I attend an unsafe workplace is unlawful and constitutes a fundamental breach of contract. I'm considering resigning in response to that, which would amount to unfair constructive dismissal.

Second, you failed your duty in respect of health and safety. I’m being asked to attend a workplace that is unsafe due to coronavirus. I could work from home, but I’m not being allowed. I’m regularly being called into meetings in the office that are either unecessary or could be conducted remotely. I’ve been subjected to detrimental treatment in respect of my health and safety, which is a violation of s.44 and potentially of s.100 of the Employment Rights Act 1996.
My pay's been cut because of refusing to attend an unsafe workplace.
My pay's been cut because I refused to attend an unsafe workplace

I've been unlawfully subjected to a detriment because of my refusal to attend an unsafe workplace. In particular, I've had my income reduced unfairly. [Provide details of the pay cut].

I don't have to accept any reduction in pay because I've taken protected action under the Employment Rights Act. I'm entitled to full pay under section 44. Therefore, you should reimburse the income I've lost so far and put me back on the payroll.

If steps aren't taken to ensure that my workplace is safe [provide detail if possible], I intend to continue to exercise my rights.
Making me attend unsafe workplace is unlawful - constructive dismissal.
I resigned because the employer made me attend an unsafe workplace.
Your insistence that I attend an unsafe workplace was unlawful and constituted a fundamental breach of contract. I resigned in response to that, which amounts to unfair constructive dismissal.
I was dismissed because I refused to attend an unsafe workplace
You dismissed me because I refused to attend an unsafe workplace. The dismissal is therefore unfair under s.100 of the Employment Rights Act.
My pay was cut and I was dimissed because I refused to attend an unsafe workplace

You dismissed me because I refused to attend an unsafe workplace. The dismissal is therefore unfair under s.100 of the Employment Rights Act. I also had my income reduced unlawfully because I took this protected action.
Your seemingly neutral practice discriminated against me indirectly.
I felt discriminated against by one of the employer's policies/procedures

Your practice of [explain the practice] placed me at a disadvantage because of my [insert relevant protected characteristic]. This is unlawful indirect discrimination.

[Add detail, explaining how the employer’s seemingly neutral policy or practice affected people of your protected characteristic.]
Your seemingly neutral practice has discriminated against me indirectly.
I feel discriminated against by one of the employer's policies/procedures

Your practice of [explain the practice] has placed me at a disadvantage because of my [insert relevant protected characteristic]. This is unlawful indirect discrimination.

[Add detail, explaining how the employer’s seemingly neutral policy or practice affects people of your protected characteristic.]
My contract states the pay I'm entitled to
My contract of employment provides that I be paid £ [insert £ amount] by way of [insert ONE of the following: salary OR bonus OR commission OR car allowance OR (insert other specified benefit)].
You reduced my salary without my agreement.
Payments became due but weren't paid. I didn't agree to the deduction and want it rectified
The following payments became due and weren't paid: [list sums and dates here].   I didn't agree to this deduction and therefore it's unlawful. Please rectify it.
Intend to claim the difference between what was paid and owed to me.
If the employer doesn't pay me what is owed, I'll bring a claim
If you don't rectify this unlawful deduction, I intend to present a claim for the difference between what you paid and what I was owed.
- payment of the difference between what you paid and what I was contractually entitled to.
The unlawful deductions of my wages had a negative effect on me.
The unlawful deductions from my wages had a negative effect on me

This unlawful deduction of my wages has [insert whichever of the following apply: 
-- negatively affected my confidence and mental health 
-- caused me stress
-- caused me financial hardship].
Unlawful deductions of wages are a breach of contract - entitled to resign and claim constructive dismissal.
I could resign because of the unlawful deductions made from my wages
This unlawful deduction fundamentally breaches my contract of employment and would entitle me to resign and claim constructive dismissal in an employment tribunal.
I was accused of gross misconduct, but what I did wasn't serious enough
Gross misconduct is a serious allegation against an employee. I was accused of [add detail]. This isn’t serious enough to be classified as gross misconduct.
Gross misconduct - investigation and dismissal unfair.
The employer didn't investigate properly or give me a chance to respond, before dimissing me for gross misconduct

Dismissal for gross misconduct must follow a fair procedure and be fair in the circumstances. This includes investigating the matter properly and giving the employee a chance to respond. This wasn't done in my case. [Add detail, if possible.]
I was dismissed for poor performance, but in fact it was discrimination
I was told that I was being dismissed for poor performance. However, I was in fact dimissed because of [protected characteristic(s)] discrimination.

My performance wasn't poor: 
[Add up to three short bullet points as to why you believe that. e.g.
-- In my last appraisal I was told I exceeded all of my targets...
-- 
--                                                                                                                      ]
i am caroline this is my third person para
You didn't follow a reasonable procedure before dismissing for poor performance.
The employer didn't give me a chance to improve my performance, before dismissing me

You didn't follow a reasonable procedure for performance management before dimissing me. That includes adequate warnings and an opportunity to improve. In particular, [add up to 3 bullet points.] 

The dismissal was therefore unfair.
I have reasons to show there was no reduction in my work
There's no reduction in the amount of my work because [insert reasons to support this. If more than one distinct reason, add up to three bullet points.]
I wasn't warned or adequately consulted about the redundancy situation.
The selection criteria were unfair (but not discriminatory)
I should not have been in the redundancy pool
I was included within a pool of employees who are at risk of redundancy. I should not have been because [explain why].
I was lonely in the redundancy pool - others should have been included
I was included within a pool of employees who were at risk of redundancy. Others [Name(s)/position(s)] should have been included in the pool because [explain why].
Someone else should have been made redundant
If the redundancy process had been fair someone else would have been made redundant, rather than me.
If a meaningful consultation were to be carried out, I wouldn't be made redundant because ... .
I can show that a fair redundancy process wouldn't lead to redundancy
This shows that the selection process was predetermined.
The outcome of the redundancy process was predetermined.
The current redundancy selection criteria are unfair [and discriminatory] because ... .

The factors or criteria used in the selection process are unfair and discriminatory because [set out your reasons for thinking that the factors or criteria used are unfair - provide up to 3 bullet point examples, starting with the strongest such as discrimination, e.g:
-- 'The selection criteria include sickness absence which discriminates against me as I am disabled and have more sickness absences than other, non-disabled, colleagues';
-- 'The criteria target part time workers which discriminates against women;'
-- 'The criteria put people with childcare responsibilities at a disadvantage, which amounts to indirect discrimination on the grounds of sex and/or marriage or civil partnership';
-- 'I am being scored a 4 for Performance when all my appraisals have scored at least 6 for this criterion;'
-- 'My manager is scoring me lower than he should because he does not like me and these scores are not justified;'
-- 'The work I have done on [insert job/task details] has not been taken into account.']
My redundancy was motivated by discrimination.

Selecting me for redundancy amounts to [protected characteristic(s)] discrimination. That's clear because [set out your reasons for thinking that, e.g.: 
-- 'the selection criteria include sickness absence which discriminates against me as I am disabled and had more sickness absences than other, non-disabled, colleagues'
-- 'the criteria target part time workers which discriminates against women;' 
-- 'The criteria put people with childcare responsibilities at a disadvantage, which amounts to indirect discrimination on the grounds of sex and/or marriage or civil partnership'.]
I have a disability  - choosing me for potential redundancy is discriminatory.
I was made redundant whilst off work because of a disability

I have [name condition(s)]. This impairment is longterm and has a substantial effect on day-to-day activities and I have been absent from work for [  ] months because of this/these conditions. You could have made reasonable adjustments to help me return to work. [In particular ... set out the adjustments if possible.]In these circumstances, the business's failure to help me return to work and to choose me for potential redundancy is unfavourable treatment and amounts to disability discrimination.
You're implementing the restructure in bad faith to remove me because ... .
There's no reduction in the amount of work and I know why they want to get rid of me
There's no reduction in my work, they just want to get rid of me (but I don't know why)
There is no reduction in the amount of my work, so this isn't a genuine redundancy.  You are acting in bad faith to remove me from the organisation.
No actual reduction in work - redundancy based on anticipation of losses only.
They anticipate work reduction, but it hasn't happened yet

This is not a genuine redundancy situation as there hasn't been an actual reduction in the amount of the type of work that I do. Selecting me for redundancy is based on a speculative anticipation of losses only. Therefore, my redundancy would be unfair.

Anticipating [losses] doesn’t mean I’m redundant - there is still the same amount of work to be done, therefore I’m not being dismissed because of a reduction in the amount of the type of work I do. For this reason, this is not a genuine redundancy dismissal and and resulting dismissal will inevitably be unfair.
My redundancy would be unfair as it doesn't comply with the law.
They haven't adequately consulted about redundancy

To dismiss fairly for redundancy there has to be a genuine redundancy situation and a fair process. A fair redundancy process must include a ‘meaningful consultation’, where the employee’s views are considered and redundancy may be avoided. My views have not been considered and the outcome is predetermined. Therefore, any decision to make me redundant would be an unfair dismissal.
They haven't adequately consulted about redundancy, and I can explain why
Should be selected for the new role.
They created a new role and should have been appointed me to it
The newly created role [insert role title] contains many of my duties and I should have been appointed to that role or at the very least considered for it.
The alternative job offered isn’t suitable
The alternative job of [name the job] offered to me isn’t a suitable alternative because [explain why].
You were implementing the restructure in bad faith to remove me because ... .
There was no reduction in my work and I know why they want to get rid of me
There was no reduction in my work, they just wanted to get rid of me
There was no reduction in the amount of my work, so it wasn't a genuine redundancy. You are acting in bad faith to remove me from the organisation.
My redundancy is unfair as it doesn't comply with the law.
They didn't adequately consult about redundancy

To dismiss fairly for redundancy there has to be a genuine redundancy situation and a fair process. A fair redundancy process must include a ‘meaningful consultation’, where the employee’s views are considered and redundancy may be avoided. My views were not considered and the outcome was predetermined. Therefore, my redundancy was unfair dismissal.
They didn't adequately consult about redundancy, and I can explain why
A suitable alternative job wasn't considered
There is a suitable alternative vacancy [name the vacancy] that hasn’t been considered for me. It’s suitable because [explain why].
My redundancy is due to whistleblowing

I’ve been selected for redundancy due to my whistleblowing. That’s clear because [explain how the redundancy is connected with your whistleblowing. E.g. 'On [date] I told you about unlawful activities [explain which] going on in the company and you told me that you had to let me go. I was then selected for redundancy.']
Bad treatment led to constructive dismissal.
I resigned because I was treated really badly

Your treatment of me amounted to a fundamental breach of the implied term of trust and confidence in our employment agreement. Accordingly, my resignation was unfair constructive dismissal, and would entitle me to claim compensation in an employment tribunal. [In particular: add up to the three bullet points summarising the poor treatment.]
They suspended me for discriminatory reasons

I was suspended for discriminatory reasons. In particular, 
[list up to 3 bullet points proving this, starting with the strongest.]
My suspension was a kneejerk reaction.
I was suspended with no reason given

My suspension was a 'kneejerk' reaction. You gave no reason as to why suspension was necessary. It was a breach of the implied term of trust and confidence between the employer and employee. I'm entitled to resign and claim constructive dismissal.
The reason given for my suspension was inadequate

My suspension was a 'kneejerk' reaction. The reason given for suspending me was [insert reason]. This wasn't an adequate reason because [explain why]. Therefore, it was a breach of the implied term of trust and confidence between the employer and employee. I'm entitled to resign and claim constructive dismissal.
I refer to my suspension, which was discriminatory and due to whistleblowing.
I was suspended because I complained about something unlawful

I was suspended because of my whistleblowing.In particular, 
[list up to 3 bullet points proving this, starting with the strongest.]
I complained about unlawful activities in my workplace and has been mistreated as a result

I made the following protected disclosure(s):
[insert dates and details of your complaints about unlawful activity].

I've been subjected to the following detriments because of my whistleblowing:
[insert details].
I resigned because I was mistreated after complaining about something unlawful

I made the following protected disclosure(s): 
[insert dates and details of your complaints about unlawful activity]. 

I was subjected to the following detriments because of my whistleblowing: 
[insert details]. 

This mistreatment led to my resignation on [date], which amounts to unfair constructive dismissal.
I was dimissed because I complained about unlawful activities

I made the following protected disclosure(s): 
[insert dates and details of your complaints about unlawful activity in the workplace]. 

This resulted in my dismissal on [date], which is automatically unfair due to whistleblowing.
Yes, but I haven't received the outcome of my grieavance yet.

As you’re aware, I recently submitted a grievance relating to these issues. I haven’t yet received the outcome of the grievance, but I’m now taking this alternative route in a genuine attempt to resolve the dispute.
Yes, but I'm not satisfied with the outcome of my grieavance.

As you’re aware, I recently submitted a grievance relating to these issues. I’m not satisfied with the outcome of the grievance, so I’m now taking this alternative route in a genuine attempt to resolve the dispute.
The reason given for my dismissal was unfair
The reason given for my dismissal was [add reason]. This isn’t one of the potentially fair reasons for dismissal listed in the Employment Rights Act. Accordingly, my dismissal was unfair.
No reason was given for my dismissal
You didn’t give a reason for my dismissal, which makes the dismissal blatantly unfair.
The reason given for my dismissal was unfair and thus it was discrimination
The reason given for my dismissal was [add reason]. As this isn’t a potentially fair reason for dismissal, my dismissal must have been discriminatory.
No reason was given for my dismissal and it was discrimination
As you didn’t give a reason for dismissing me, the dismissal must have been discriminatory.

The working environment is so toxic it constitutes a repudiatory breach of contract. Therefore, I'm entitled to resign and claim constructive dismissal.

In particular, [provide up to three bullet points showing how your employer treated you so badly. If just one point, keep on this line. If more than one, bullet point format is good.]
I resigned due to toxic working environment

The working environment was so toxic it constituted a repudiatory breach of contract. Therefore, my resignation was constructive dismissal.

In particular, [provide up to three bullet points showing how your employer treated you so badly. If just one point, keep on this line. If more than one, bullet point format is good.]

I've been treated badly, including:

[add 3-5 bullet points of strong, recent examples, trying to keep them within the last 2-3 months if possible]

I was treated so badly it amounted to a fundamental breach of the implied term of trust and confidence in our employment agreement. This bad treatment included:

[add 3-5 bullet points of strong, recent examples, trying to keep them within the last 2-3 months if possible].

My performance doesn't warrant performance management because:

[provide up to 3 bullet point reasons].
My performance improvement plan was unfairly implemented
The implementation of the performance improvement plan was unfair and you have failed to follow your own procedure.
My performance improvement plan was disability disrimination
Even if you can show issues with my performance (which isn't accepted), the performance improvement plan was clearly discriminatory and put in place due to matters arising from my disability.
I am prepared to present an employment tribunal claim for discrimination.
I am prepared to present an employment tribunal claim for discrimination

I am prepared to present an employment tribunal claim. The discriminatory treatment has caused extreme upset [and negatively affected my mental health], which justifies a substantial award for injury to feelings.
I'm prepared to bring a claim (including discrimination)
I am prepared to present an employment tribunal claim, which would result in substantial damages for loss of earnings and injury to feelings.
My employment no longer tenable, but reserving position.
I am considering whether to resign
Your treatment of me amounts to fundamental breach of contract, so I could resign and claim constructive dismissal. However, I have not yet decided whether to resign.
I believe that subjecting me to unnecessary and unjustified performance management is unfair and demonstrates a lack of empathy - this entitles me to resign and claim unfair constructive dismissal.
I am prepared to resign and claim compensation because of my unjustified performance management

Subjecting me to unnecessary and unjustified performance management demonstrates a lack of empathy. This is a fundamental breach of the implied term of trust and confidence in our employment agreement. It would entitle me to resign and claim compensation for unfair constructive dismissal.
I'm considering bringing a claim (except for discrimination).
I'm prepared to present a claim
I am prepared to present an employment tribunal claim, which would result in substantial damages.
Our client is prepared to present an employment tribunal claim, which would result in substantial damages.

My workload is so excessive and stressful it constitutes a repudiatory breach of contract. Therefore, I'm entitled to resign and claim constructive dismissal.

In particular, [provide up to three bullet points showing how your employer treated you so badly. If just one point, keep on this line. If more than one, bullet point format is good.]
